intro: Sabulina birjuczensis, commonly known as the Armenian sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
